Job Title: BMS Commissioning Engineer (4430)

Location: North Oxford, ME

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Are you a Tridium Niagara expert? Can you commission BMS controls equipment such as fan coil units and chilled beams? Do you have experience working on large construction projects?

Then our in-house MEP Engineering business, Crown House Technologies, is the company for you. We are looking for an experienced BMS commissioning engineer to join the team on our Oxford North scheme. Here we will deliver one million sq ft (92,903 sq m) of laboratory and workspaces, 480 new homes, hotel, nursery, cafes, bars, three public parks and infrastructure.

If you join us you'll be a valued member of an industry leading team which can offer you an exciting and varied career with access to some truly great projects. We are committed to extensive training, development, and long-term career opportunities and as such this role is suitable for someone who is seeking long-term career progression.

Role Overview

Commission Motor Centre Control (MCC) and outstations to monitor and control mechanical systems such as ventilation air plant systems or pumps for water systems (BMS) and Electrical meters (EMS) within the same systems.To commission BMS controls equipment mounted in third-party equipment such as Fan Coil Units (FCU'S) and Air Source Heat Pumps (ASHP's)To prove the interaction between the BMS and third-party equipment such as Air handling Units (AHU's), ground source heat pumps and chillers.Ensure all relevant paperwork associated with the above is completed in line with the commissioning works that is undertaken.Ensuring handover of fully operational BEMS Systems.Investigating and repairing faults.Responsible for ensuring the project is delivered on time and on budget to a satisfied client.Responsible for the commercial performance of the project including the preparation, submission, and agreement of variations.Overall responsibility for health and safety management on all managed projects.Ensuring standard documents are continually used and maintained including the Schedule of Deliverables, Project Dashboard, Functional Design Specifications, Points Schedules, Panel Drawings, Technical submittals, RFI's, etc

What do we look for?

Electrical Engineering qualifications (full electrical apprenticeship or equivalent)Proven track record of delivering BEMS systems specifically Schneider, Tridium Exceptional technical knowledge of BEMSExperience working with BACNET and or ModbusValid CSCS or ECS site card

About Us

Crown House Technologies (Cht) is one of the UK's most advanced, and innovative, engineering and business services specialists. Part of the Laing O'Rourke Group, and founded on more than 200 years of experience, we are a leading construction and infrastructure technology services provider, supplying a complete Building Services package with communications, ICT, intelligent building, monitoring, BMS and the UK's largest mechanical, electrical & public health manufacturing facility - a 129,000 sq. ft factory - offering Off-site manufacturing and assembly for our digitally engineered modular MEICA packages.

As part of the Disability Confident scheme, we would like to enable access to candidates with long term health conditions and disabilities through the â€˜Offer an interview scheme'. This supports applicants that meet the essential criteria by offering an interview for the advertised position. Please let us know prior to interview what adjustments are required as well as discussing how we can support you in the workplace.

We want to ensure our recruitment process is accessible to all. If you need the application form in an alternative format or you would like to know more about our recruitment process, please email resourcingteam@laingorourke.com

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
